CIRCULAR 22  / 2000 
 
 
SUB: ADDITIONAL CREW MEMBER (ACM) ON THE FLIGHT- 
PROCEDURE THERE OF. 
 
 
 
An instance has come to the notice of this Bureau wherein a person impersonated as 
the pilot of Air Carrier and managed to get access up to the aircraft on the plea that he was to 
travel as an Additional Crew Member (ACM) on the flight.  The person did not have an ACM 
slip or any identification documents to substantiate his claim.  In spite of this, the airlines 
staff facilitated his entry up to the aircraft by issuing a boarding card to him.  The captain of 
the flight also went to the extent of accommodating the stranger as an ACM in the flight even 
when the identity of the person was suspect.  However, it is to the credit of the Airport 
manager of the Airlines also overruled the Captain of the flight and prevented a suspect 
person from being taken as an ACM in the flight.  During the course of event, it was revealed 
that the Airlines staff issued a boarding pass to the person concerned though he did not 
qualify to be issued with the same. 
 
 
The above fact brings in to sharp focus the procedural weakness and also scant regard 
for minimum-security measures on the part of the airlines.  In order to ensure that such 
mishaps do not recur, it has been decided that all the airlines should strictly adhere to the 
below mentioned norms: - 
 
(i) 
The Airlines should not issue additional crew member slip to any person 
without proper authorization; 
 
(ii) 
Airlines should issue their own identity card to their regular employees; 
 
(iii) 
In no case, a boarding pass should be issued to an employee of an airlines to 
facilitate his /her going to the tarmac; 
 
(iv) 
Uniforms / stores / other equipments to the employees of the Airlines should 
be issued only after establishing the identity of the person that  he / she is a 
regular employee of the Airlines on its pay roll 
 
(i) 
Dummy tickets or dummy boarding pass should also not be issued to any person; 
 
(ii) 
Pilot should not have a say in the matters relating to issue of additional crew 
member slips and the authorization of the Station Manager or the Airport Manager 
of the Airlines should be final. 
 
The above guidelines shall come into effect immediately. 
 
 
All the Airlines should intimate the Bureau about the nature of job in different 
sections like operations, commercial ,stores, passenger handling etc.  so that areas 
vulnerable to aviation security can be identified and preventive action recommended.
